intro: Eriodictyon crassifolium subsp. grayanum, commonly known as Gray's yerba santa, is a shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its gray-green, hairy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves contain essential oils and have been used traditionally for their medicinal properties. It plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
